title: Quality EHS Manager (12-Month Contract)
description:
Company Overview
 
BLG LOGISTICS is a seaport and logistics service provider with an international network. For more than 145 years, our hallmark has been logistics driven by both passion and pragmatism. We create logistics for our customers in retail and industry by applying our expertise to develop and implement innovative, highly sophisticated, and future-oriented solutions. Today, the BLG Group is represented with almost 100 locations and branches in Europe, America, Africa, and Asia. Our AUTOMOBILE and CONTAINER divisions are market leaders in Europe. Our CONTRACT division is among Germany's leading providers.
BLG LOGISTICS aims to be climate-neutral by 2030. In fact, we are the first German logistics service provider with a scientifically recognized climate protection goal. As an employer, we foster a personal touch, value our employees' contribution, and keep our sights firmly on the future. Including all associated companies, BLG LOGISTICS currently provides some 20,000 jobs worldwide.
This role is a 12-Month Contract.
This role requires 50% of travel to all 5 of our locations. 
- Northport, AL
- Vance, AL
- Greenville, SC
- Spartanburg, SC
- Ladson, SC
Benefits
- Medical
- Dental 
- Vision
- Company Paid Benefits:
- Short Term Disability
- Long Term Disability
- Life Insurance
- Accidental Death and Dismemberment
- Paid Time Off/Vacation Time
- 12 Paid Holidays
- Safe Harbor & ROTH 401K Retirement plan with Company Match. 
- Supplemental Insurance 
- Fraud Remediation Plan 
- Summary:
 
Manages the overall QM and QA needs for the Company, including but not limited to: ISO Certification, Internal Audits, External Audits, Customer Audits, Operational and Administrative Quality support, Environmental Health and Safety, standards and implementations, and point of contact for all Quality related questions.
 
- Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
- Understands the quality requirements for the processes he/she works with.
- Inspects the operations to ensure that the correct processes, and quality standards are being followed.
- Develops and manages the system audit within the product line and areas by establishing requirements and measurement.
- Develop a quality plan with clear definition of objectives and actions with timelines.
- Complete process audits for conformance to instructions and customer requirements.
- Develop plans to be able to meet ISO system requirements.
- Leads efforts in achieving BLG Quality Management System Requirements.
- Compiles and writes training materials and conducts training sessions on quality topics.
- Direct activities of Quality department associates.
- Assists operations in achieving total customer satisfaction in Quality, Delivery, and Cost.
- Takes a leadership partnership role with continuous improvement.
- Review claims and quality Issues with Operations, support countermeasures identification and audit implementation. Is expected to be able to communicate key issues and actions.
- Develops and maintains the system to ensure Inspection Instructions are up to date, if applicable.
- BIC Maintenance
- Update the organizational matrix of records
- Performs other related duties as assigned by management.
- Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position have supervisor responsibilities over the Quality Engineers & Quality Specialist position.
- Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
- Education and/or Experience:
- College Degree or equivalent with at least 2 years of education beyond or at least 10+ years of experience working in a quality environment.
- Experience in conducting internal audits and quality control.
- Significant work with ISO and other certifications.
- Knowledge and expertise with Environmental Health and Safety regulations.
- Experience in creating standards and implementation. 
- Skills and Knowledge:
- Advanced analytical skills including investigation.
- Ability to focus on detail and understanding the focus of the organization.
- Strong communication skills with teams and customers.
- Computer literate within the PC environment. Basic computer skills.
- Percentage of time performing the job will include: 10% standing, 10% walking, 10% writing, 40% checking, 20% observing, 5% speaking and 5% listening.
- Reasoning Ability:
Ability to interpret data and recognize and document trends. Ability to utilize analytical tools and common sense understanding to implement problem solving and improvement measures.
- Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
Certification relating to logistics and quality management are advantageous but not required. (e.g. CSCMP, Six-Sigma, etc.) Valid Driver’s License is required.
 
- Other Skills and Abilities:
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database software; Project Management software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. Ability to speak, write and understand German and Spanish; preferred but not required.
- Other Qualifications:
May be required to support the ramp-up of facilities and projects outside of the Southeastern United States. The ability and willingness to travel, including for extended periods, is a necessity of the job. 
- Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.
- Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job is usually performed in an office environment, but may necessitate activities in a production or other environment of a client. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Purchasing Specialist
description:
Description:
Who we are
:
The EDAG Group is a globally leading, independent engineering services provider that combines excellent engineering with the latest technology trends.
With a global network of some 60 branches, the EDAG Group realizes projects in the Vehicle Engineering, Electrics/Electronics and Production Solutions segments. Drawing on more than 50 years of engineering experience, EDAG's proprietary 360-degree development approach has become a hallmark of quality in the holistic development of vehicles and smart factories. The company's interdisciplinary expertise in the areas of software and digitization provides it with crucial skills to actively shape dynamic transformation processes as an innovative partner.
With an interdisciplinary team of around 8,600 experts, the EDAG Group develops unique mobility and industrial solutions for customers that include the world's leading automotive and non-automotive companies. The company is listed on the stock exchange since 2015 and generated revenues of € 796 million in 2022.
This is how you will grow
:
- Maintain and monitor compliance with corporate purchasing policies and procedures.
- Creates, reviews, and processes requisitions and replenishment orders for inventory of RV Parts
- Requesting cost proposals and negotiating total cost and delivery.
- Places Purchase Orders with vendors and confirm confirmations.
- Proactively manage inventory and reconcile Open Purchase Orders to ensure timely delivery and prompt payment of invoices.
- Monitoring of backorders and substitutions
- Coordinates and creates Vendor Returns for the return of products to the vendor for credit.
- Collaborates with Accounts Payable and vendors to resolve discrepancies specific to pricing, receiving, and match discrepancies.
- Ability to develop and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with suppliers as well as contacts within the company.
- Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks or projects concurrently.
- Self-starter able to work independently.
- Maintaining records of all transactions, purchase orders, receipts
- Have a working knowledge of parts for each type of unit, general parts required, and an understanding of subparts that will be needed for installation.
Requirements:
This is how you will take us forward:
- Experience in the automotive industry preferred
- A minimum of two (2) years' of relevant professional experience in Procurement or Supply Chain
- Associates degree
- SAP experience,
- Proficiency MS Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access) 
**NO C2C or staffing agencies submittals**
No Sponsorship is Available at this Time
No relocation- Preference will be given to local candidates
EDAG Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce. EDAG Inc. does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status or any other state, local, or federal employment laws. EDAG’s intends that all qualified applicants be given equal opportunity and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors.

title: Quality Specialist
description:
Please send your resume in Microsoft Word format if you are interested in the Quality Specialist opportunity in Vance, AL (35490). This is a contract-to-hire position, market rates and we can offer hourly or salary compensation, benefits, and 5-weeks of PTO!!!
If you are not interested, please forward to your network.AMS Staffing offers referral fees should they be hired.
Title: 
 Quality Specialist
Location:
Vance, AL (35490)
Rate/Salary:
Market Rate
Type:
Contract to hire
Core Hours:
7am 4pm, Monday Friday 
The deadline for candidate submission is 12:00pm CST, Wednesday, December 20, 2023.Late submissions will be rejected.
- Shift Schedule:Day Shift 
- Core Working Hours:7am 4pm, Monday Friday 
- Weekly Overtime:2 hours per day as needed 
- Weekend Work: Only as needed
- Travel: 50% in the U.S. only, etc.
- Cell Phone Required: Yes
- Special PPE Required: Standard Assembly shop PPE
- Assignment Start: January 2, 2024
- Assignment End:December 21, 2024 with potential for an extension of contract
Relocation expenses may be offered for highly qualified candidates, but that rate must be referenced in the attached bid form.Preference will be given to local candidates
Please reply with an updated resume in Microsoft Word format
JOB DESCRIPTION
Under general supervision, this position is responsible for the color harmony audit process and support of Manufaktur launch. Performs the checks, analyze results, and document the results in computer systems. Advanced planning of the process and initiates problem solving when a discrepancy is identified and tracks until a resolution is implemented. Ability to perform processes and maintain these systems throughout the life cycle of the given product. Supports Central Q in the analysis, prioritization, investigation, and ultimate resolution of product concerns throughout the product life.
Duties and responsibilities
- Assure customer satisfaction for both our internal and external customers by maintaining and performing the color harmony audit process and ensure that company complies with all relevant company standards.
- Perform and train on the use of inspection and test plans, standards and acceptance criteria and procedures/work instructions, according to company standards (MBN/VAs).
- Adapt Color Harmony Audit process for new models, new colors, and running changes.
- Develop reports in order to provide the results to the organization.
- Coordinate with internal/external partners in regular meetings.Lead Role for Interior Color / Support Role for Exterior Color.
- Investigate and eliminate any non conformities in the color harmony audit process and follow up on corrective actions, including but not limited to conducting line trial and special evaluations.
- Implement and maintain reporting database and supporting software within the Color Harmony Audit Process.
- Implement and maintain inspection tools and equipment within the Color Harmony Audit
- Perform safe work practices and participate in trainings and safety programs in a positive and proactive way by following safety rules, procedures, regulations, standards and laws.Report all unsafe acts, unsafe conditions, and injuries to supervisor or Human Resources.
- Support of MANUFAKTUR launch.
- Work safely 100% of the time.
- Perform other duties as required.
Professional Experience
Co-Op/ internship and/ or up to 2 years' professional experience in the following area:
- Quality function in an automotive manufacturing environment.
Required Skills 
(These skills are essential to perform the job)
- Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
- Working knowledge of MS Office applications.
- Proven capability to audit vehicles parts.
- Strong written and verbal communication skills.
- Ability to pass Ishara Color Blindness and FM 100 Hue tests.
Preferred skills 
(These skills are not essential but useful)
- Working knowledge of ISO 14000, ISO/TS 16949 Management systems.
- Working experience in QDA, SmartChart, PLUS, MRS, ZEUS, and CAT systems.
- Experience in assessing cost of quality.
- German language skills.
Minimum Level of Education 
(Note: Engineering and/or IT MUST require technical degrees)
This position requires a bachelors degree in:
- Mechanical Engineering
- Industrial Engineering
- Computer Engineering/Computer Science
- Chemical Engineering
- Or related area or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
Company Description
Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is one of the leading automotive service providers in the nation with over 300 locations across 21 states. We employ experienced, certified technicians trained to provide premium total-car care, and we use state-of-the-art equipment and premium parts to ensure the quality of our work. In addition to the oil change, our teams are capable of providing specialty services, tire services, as well as a variety of mechanical services, while continuing to place an emphasis on customer experience and being your one-stop automotive service provider. Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers continues to grow while maintaining our vision to continuously be the preeminent automotive maintenance provider, leading our industry through excellence, innovation, and growth.
Job Description
The Accounts Receivable Specialist will assist the Accounts Receivable department in the daily functions of the Express Oil Change & Tire Engineer’s chain-wide Fleet Billing Platform (currently encompasses billing and credit management for more than 25 companies, more than 200 stores and approximately 2,000 plus statements per month) to insure successful operations. The Accounts Receivable Specialist's primary function and focus will be on collections and Accounts Payable, but they will also assist in posting cash receipts.
Primary Responsibilities
 
include (but are not limited to):
- Perform collections activities including phone calls and emails 
- Utilize Lockstep Collect software to document contacts and maintain daily record of customer interactions
- Assist with cash receipt posting: ACH and check payments
- Assist with all customer inquiries related to copies of invoices, if necessary 
- Assist with mailing and emailing of statements to customers
- Assist store managers and Franchise owners with fleet billing inquiries 
- Ad hoc duties as assigned
Qualifications
We are looking for:
- Minimum of 5 years of Accounting/Collections experience
- Proficiency in Lockstep Collect Software preferred
- Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 a plus
- Experience with Sage 100 preferred
- Strong knowledge of Microsoft products (including Word, Excel) preferred
- Proficiency with Adobe Acrobat Pro required
- Must be willing to call customers daily to follow up on past due accounts
- Must have excellent communications skills, both oral and written
Additional Information
All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Work Opportunity Tax Credits – Express Oil
Express Oil participates in the Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) program, which ADP administers on behalf of the company. Please follow the steps listed below to screen for the WOTC program. We appreciate your cooperation.
 Applicant Instructions
- Open https://tcs.adp.com/mavistac 
- Please answer each question to complete the voluntary screening
- Eligible applicants will be asked to Electronically Sign and click Submit to complete the screening
- Ineligible applicants will be asked to click Submit to finish the screening; You will not be asked to electronically sign

title: Precision Measurement Service Technician I
description:
Job Summary: 
Responsible for performing quality calibrations adhering to corporate quality standards and procedures.
Essential Functions:
- 
Calibration encompassing the following core disciplines: Temperature, Pressure, Flow, Vibration, Mass, Electrical, Electronics, Time, Frequency, Radio Frequency, Torque, Force and Dimension. Additional training will be provided post-hire as needed.
- 
Prepare for all on-sites as assigned by Lead Tech or Service Manager; this includes reviewing equipment lists, procedures, specifications, and ensuring proper standards are selected for work assigned.
- 
Person must ensure he/she has calibration stickers, PMD work orders, worksheets, tags, cleaning supplies, directions, customer contact information and survey cards; downloading customer information to an on-site laptop may be required.
- 
Person must ensure all company issued tools and property are in proper working order and in calibration.
- 
Perform clerical work associated with calibration activities including certificates of calibration. Must provide the original data worksheet for final inspection by Quality.
- 
Perform quality inspection of calibrated equipment as approved by the Quality Manager.
- 
All certificates for equipment calibrated on-site and in house shall be completed in a timely manner (within 48 hours of job completion.)
- 
Keep in good order all tools and equipment, practice good housekeeping
- 
Maintain a safety and customer service mindset at all times
- 
Consistently maintain good work attendance and productive work ethic.
- 
Will perform other duties as assigned by the Service Manager
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
- 
A strong understanding of a wide variety of precision measurement equipment, to include the care and use of Instrumentation, Gages, and Precision Measurement Equipment; calibration program management, and Measurement Principles.
- 
Be proficient in gage management software
- 
Be computer proficient in all Microsoft Office applications
- 
Have a strong understanding of computer system peripherals and communication configurations
- 
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
- 
Have excellent written and oral communication skills, both internally and externally
- 
Demonstrate self motivation, initiative, honesty, integrity, and attention to detail
- 
Have a valid driver’s license and clean driving record
- 
Associates Degree in a technical discipline preferred; Instrumentation, Industrial, Mechanical, or Electronics Engineering, for example. Navy or Marine Corp GCAMS / ACTS , AF PMEL, or Army MOS – 94H Test Measurement & Diagnostic Equipment Support Specialist
Core Competencies
- 
Commitment to Excellence - Check your work
- 
Customer Relationship Management - communicate with customers to deliver better service
- 
Methodical Approach - troubleshooting
- 
Team Building
Physical Demands:
Stands greater than four hours at a time
May require walking 2 – 4 miles during an 8 hour period
Stoops and bends below knee level 2 – 4 times an hour
Lifts and carries less than 50 pounds but greater than 25 pounds repetitively
Climbs stairs more than four times in an eight hour shift
Pushes / pulls objects greater than 25 pounds
Reaches out
Reaches overhead
Repetitively uses feet
Repetitively uses hands (computer keyboard)
Grips with hands

title: Truss Production Manager
description:
We are a leading manufacturer and distributor of building materials .With a commitment to excellence and innovation, we serve a diverse clientele across varies segments of the building material industry. Our truss plant plays a pivotal role in our operations while servicing builders and contractors in the region. 
Job Description:
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Truss Production Manager to oversee operations at one of our plants in Alabama.The ideal candidate will be a strategic leader with a proven track record in manufacturing management, particularly within the truss production industry. This role requires exceptional organizational skills, a keen eye for quality control, and a dedication to maximizing operational efficiency.
Key Responsibilities:
 
Leadership and Team Management:
- Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of production staff, supervisors, and support personnel.
- Foster a culture of safety, quality, and continuous improvement.
- Set clear performance objectives and provide regular feedback to ensure team alignment with company goals.
Production Planning and Optimization:
- Develop and implement production schedules to meet customer demand while optimizing resources and minimizing downtime.
- Coordinate with sales and logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of products to customers.
- Implement best practices to enhance operational efficiency and maximize output.
Quality Assurance and Compliance:
- Establish and enforce quality control standards to ensure that all products meet industry specifications and customer expectations.
- Conduct regular inspections and audits to identify areas for improvement and address any non-conformities.
- Ensure compliance with relevant safety regulations and company policies.
Inventory Management and Cost Control:
- Oversee inventory levels and procurement processes to maintain adequate stock levels while minimizing excess inventory.
- Monitor production costs and identify opportunities for cost-saving initiatives.
- Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to develop and manage budgets effectively.
Continuous Improvement:
- Lead initiatives to drive operational excellence, including process optimization, technology integration, and employee training.
- Analyze production data and performance metrics to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
- Implement lean manufacturing principles and other best practices to enhance productivity and reduce waste.
Qualifications:
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in a leadership role within the truss manufacturing industry.
- Strong knowledge of truss production processes, equipment, and materials.
- Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale production operations and achieving operational targets.
- Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and production management software.
- Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive results in a fast-paced environment.
We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and advancement. Apply now to become part of our dynamic team!

title: Job File Coordinator
description:
Do you love helping people through difficult situations?
Then, dont miss your chance to join our Franchise as a new Job File Coordinator. In this position, you will be making a difference each and every day. We have a sincere drive towards the goal of helping make fire and water damage Like it never even happened!
Were seeking someone who is great on the phone, has excellent analytical skills, is detail-oriented, and is a serious multi-tasker. If you are self-motivated and have superb interpersonal skills, then youll thrive in this work environment. Our idea of the ultimate candidate is one who is proactive, experienced, truly enjoys providing superior service, and loves taking ownership. Are you highly dependable and excited about routinely exceeding expectations? Then you may be our perfect hero!
If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Job File Coordinator. In this role, your proficiency in managing intricate documentation and ensuring accuracy will play a pivotal part in our mission to restore fire and water damage and make it " Like it never even happened."
As a valued SERVPRO Franchise employee, you will receive a competitive pay rate with the opportunity to learn and grow.
Primary Responsibilities:
 Monitor the status of job files, ensuring a seamless flow throughout the entire process.
 Supervise the status of job file audits, guaranteeing adherence to established standards.
 Maintain and update work-in-progress (WIP) job files, ensuring they are organized and
current.
 Ensure strict compliance with client requirements, ensuring their needs are met with
excellence.
 Review and validate initial field documentation, maintaining a high level of accuracy.
 Create preliminary estimates, drawing upon your analytical skills to provide precise
assessments.
 Coordinate daily job file activities, facilitating efficient and effective workflow.
 Perform timely backups of job files, safeguarding critical data.
 Maintain clear and effective communication with both internal and external stakeholders.
 Generate comprehensive job file reports, enabling progress tracking and assessment.
 Complete thorough reviews of job file documentation, ensuring readiness for upload and the
audit process.
 Execute meticulous job file audits, leaving no detail unchecked.
 Finalize job files upon completion, verifying that all necessary steps have been taken.
 Collaborate with and support other departments as needed, fostering a cohesive team
environment.
Position Requirements:
- A minimum of 2 years of administrative or office-related experience.
- Experience in constructing mortgage closing packets or packaging healthcare claims for an
- Insurance Company is highly relevant.
- Familiarity with estimate writing, job file processes, and quality assurance is a distinct advantage.
- Exposure to a service industry environment is a plus.
- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, maintaining a courteous and professional tone.
- Polite, confident, and adept at delivering excellent customer service, including strong listening and questioning skills.
- Ability to remain composed and professional, even when faced with tense or stressful situations.
- Excellent organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail.
- Highly self-motivated and goal-oriented, taking proactive initiative.
- Proficient in multitasking and skilled at managing priorities effectively.
- Comfortable thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented office environment.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel).
- Willingness and capability to quickly learn new software tools, including Xactimate and proprietary systems.
- High School Diploma or GED preferred.
- Successful completion of a background check in accordance with applicable law.
Join us in fulfilling the critical role of a Job File Coordinator, where your precision, organizational
acumen, and dedication to excellence will contribute to our ongoing success at SERVPRO.
Hours
 40 hours/week, flexible to work overtime when required

title: Senior Field Technician
description:
SENIOR FIELD TECHNICIAN
Birmingham, Alabama
Job Type:
 
- Part-time
- Temp-to-Permanent 
Pay Rate:
 $25.00 per hour
PassionHR is an HR consulting firm committed to serving our client's goals. This often involves business-to-business recruiting to hire, manage, and retain top-talent employees. We take pride in our work, performing each task with competence, confidence, and integrity. 
 PassionHR is seeking to hire an experienced 
Senior Field Technician 
to work 
part-time
 in 
Birmingham, Alabama. 
This senior position offers a unique opportunity for a seasoned professional to contribute to the growth and success of this up-and-coming IT consulting and cybersecurity firm. 
If you have a passion for leadership, advanced technical expertise, and a track record of successful project management, we encourage you to apply on-line TODAY!. 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Technical Leadership
: Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior field technicians, assisting them in resolving complex technical issues. 
On-Site Support
: Lead on-site technical support efforts, ensuring timely and effective resolution of client issues. 
Advanced Troubleshooting
: Handle escalated technical issues, including in-depth hardware and software troubleshooting for printers and personal computers.
Client Consultation
: Act as a technical consultant for clients, offering insights into optimal system configurations, upgrades, and security enhancements.
Project Coordination:
 Lead and coordinate technical projects, ensuring successful implementation and client satisfaction.
Training and Development:
 Provide training and mentorship to junior technicians, fostering their professional growth and technical skills.
Documentation and Reporting:
 Oversee the documentation of all technical activities, producing detailed reports for clients and internal use.
Quality Assurance:
 Implement and maintain quality assurance processes to ensure the highest standards of service delivery. 
QUALIFICATIONS
 
Experience
: Proven experience in a senior technical role, with a focus on hardware and software troubleshooting, project management, and client consultation.
Technical Proficiency
: Advanced knowledge of printer and PC hardware, software, networking, and cybersecurity principles.
Leadership Skills
: Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor a technical team, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.
Project Management
: Experience in successfully managing and executing technical projects from initiation to completion.
Communication
: Excellent communication skills, both technical and non-technical, to effectively interact with clients and team members.
Problem-Solving
: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to handle complex technical challenges.
Adaptability
: Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and industry best practices, staying ahead of the curve in the IT and cybersecurity landscape.
Customer-focused
: A commitment to delivering exceptional customer service and building strong client relationships.
If you are interested in this part-time 
position located in 
Birmingham, Alabama and meet the qualifications described, we encourage you to apply right away. It's easy- answer all of the questions and attach your resume. Good luck!
Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Medical Biller
description:
Medical Biller
 
Reports to Billing Supervisor
Background: Cahaba Medical Care Foundation is a community health center organization providing medical, pharmacy, dental, and behavioral health services to diverse underserved communities in Jefferson, Bibb, Perry, and Chilton counties. We are a Level 3 Patient-Centered Medical Home and Joint Commission accredited organization, committed to increasing integration and coordination of behavioral health and primary care. This is an exciting, fast paced practice with a strong mission and commitment to providing high quality care. 
Purpose: Generates revenue by entering charges, submitting claims to payers, posting 
remits, working rejections, and reviewing/working accounts receivable; making payment arrangements; collecting accounts; monitoring and pursuing delinquent accounts.
This is a full-time position. Benefits include health and dental insurance, 401(k), and paid time off.
Responsibilities & Duties
- 
Enters charges daily. Submits claims to insurance companies and government entities (including Medicare and Medicaid). Posts remits as available. Works rejections and accounts receivable.
- 
Collects delinquent accounts by establishing payment arrangements with patients; monitoring payments; following up with patients when payment lapses occur.
- 
Maintains medicare bad-debt cost report by tracking billings; monitoring collections; compiling information.
- 
Processes professional office visits and specialty services such as OB/GYN, surgical, and wound care: filing claims, posting payments, investigating delinquent balances, and otherwise maintaining patient accounts.
- 
Maintains work operations by following policies and procedures; reporting compliance issues.
- 
Maintains quality results by following standards and assures daily productivity through diligent work effort.
- 
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
- 
Serves and protects the Foundation community by adhering to professional standards, Foundation policies and procedures, federal, state, and local requirements, and JCAHO standards. 
Qualifications:
- 
Required:
- 
Time Management, Organization, Attention to Detail, Documentation Skills, Analyzing Information, General Math Skills, Resolving Conflict, Teamwork, Punctuality and Attendance, Proficient, accurate data entry, Customer service and effective, congenial phone skills, Communicate professionally even in contentious situations.
- 
Preferred:
- 
1-2 years of recent medical billing experience
- 
CH-CBS Certification (Community Health - Coding and Billing Specialist)
- 
Functional with billing software and other internet applications

title: Systems Specialist II
description:
This position is responsible for assisting in the operation of the department. An individual in this position will be expected to perform additional job-related responsibilities and duties in the field on construction projects as assigned and/or as necessary. In addition to the responsibilities below, the Systems Specialist II performs routine technical duties in startup, troubleshooting and repairing of components within building automation field cabinets, sensors, and related control devices. They typically work under the direct supervision of a higher-level building automation technician but may be asked to perform tasks at the capacity of a Systems Specialist III.
Essential Functions:
An individual must be able to successfully perform the essential functions of this position with or without a reasonable accommodation.
- Troubleshoot and make necessary repairs to building-automation-system field cabinets, including communication devices, printed circuit boards, power supplies, electrical/electronic controls, sensors, and transducers.
- Take initiative and responsibility safely performing the point-to-point checkout of end devices, e.g., use multimeter to check continuity and/or resistance of sensors, verifying sensors with calibrated meters, breaking connection at end devices to verify IO channel assignments, verifying valve stroke and fail positions, etc.
- Download modules and assist in bringing networks online.
- Communicate technical issues to senior level technicians.
- Maintain field markups and perform warranty related activities.
- Assist with maintaining regular system backups during project.
- Assist more senior level technicians in the startup of systems and equipment.
- Able to document, demonstrate and exercise non-complex systems for third party commissioning support and testing.
- Provide project demonstration and training as required for customers.
- Report to work on time and ready to perform assigned tasks. 
- Maintain company tools, test equipment, and material.
- Create thorough daily reports, per project or daily duty, and submit to Albireo project team and Operations Supervisor.
- Stay busy and look for opportunities to advance project completion.
- Communicate with jobsite personnel from other trades and Project Manager to complete project objectives.
- Be comfortable in using/navigating the company’s building automation suite and offerings.
- Identify issues and make minor program and graphic changes.
- Support a culture based on open/honest dialogue and involvement with all team members that demonstrates the value of their input and engagement in improving performance.
- Support a culture of high performance and accountability in employee and site safety as well as other aspects of the business.
Requirements
- Equivalent experience, vocational school, or an associate degree in electronics, mechanical systems, computer technology, air conditioning or similar field is preferred.
- Experience in high-availability environments like data centers, hospitals, or government facilities.
- Prior experience or familiarity with building automation systems. Knowledge of the Tridium Niagara, Distech, or Schneider Electric product line and software is preferred but not required.
- Self-starter attitude that is inquisitive, intuitive and has a willingness to learn and grow.
- Ability to document daily tasks, plan and prepare for tasks assigned.
- Must have the ability to safely climb ladders and operate man lifts, as required. Occasionally sit, kneel, crawl, reach and work above shoulders.
- Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and self-initiative.
- PC experience required.
- Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills; high quality document and report preparation.
Albireo Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Benefits
Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Basic Life Insurance
Voluntary Life Insurance
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Paid Vacation
Paid Sick Time
Paid Holidays
401K with Company match

title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA)
description:
Oak Crest Health & Wellness 
is looking to fill multiple CNA positions. 
Oak Crest is looking for dedicated CNAs to join our family! Our residents and staff are our top priority. With an exciting new culture of change starting from within come join a new inviting atmosphere that is providing top-quality care. We are excited to meet you! 
We 
offer excellent wages, weekly pay
, incredible benefits, and generous holiday pay
. 
 
If this sounds like the right long-term care opportunity for you, apply today!
Do you want to work where you can 
build meaningful and lasting relationships with residents
 and 
enjoy better hours and work-life balance
? Would you like to work with a 
talented and motivated group of individuals
 who all have the goal of 
making a difference in the lives of our patients
? If so, please read on!
ABOUT Oak Crest
 
Located in Bessemer AL, we are a skilled nursing and rehabilitation facility that is dedicated to helping our residents maximize their potential and live their lives to the fullest. We offer a modern, comfortable, and secure facility staffed by caring professionals where individuals receive the finest sub-acute medical care, rehabilitation services, and 24-hour skilled nursing care. We are committed to maintaining a facility where compassionate care is provided in an environment of respect, and dignity. It is also a 
great working environment
 for our staff as we truly value and appreciate each member of our team!
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF a Certified Nurses Aid (CNA)
 As a Certified Nurses Aid at our skilled nursing and rehabilitation facility, you play a critical role in the care of our residents. You are committed to the highest level of care and responsible for the delivery of resident care (baths, personal grooming, feeding) Turn or reposition residents who are bedridden, take residents' vital signs, and record fluid and meal intake and output. Maintains established departmental policies and procedures, objectives, quality assurance program, and safety. Strives to incorporate the facility’s goal of quality care in a personal manner with total regard for all our resident’s dignity. You always encourage an atmosphere of optimism, warmth, and sincere concern for each of our residents. We’re making a positive impact in the lives of our patients and their families bringing you a great deal of satisfaction!
QUALIFICATIONS FOR A Certified Nursing Assistant
- Valid CNA license
- Ability to quickly learn and navigate PointClickCare software

title: Service Systems Specialist I
description:
A key member of the Albireo team, the HVAC Equipment VRF Startup/Quality Control Technician independently achieves superior customer satisfaction and promotes customer retention by providing exceptional technical support and service for our customers and HVAC systems. Operating Independently, you will use your technical expertise and interpersonal skills to troubleshoot problems, recommend solutions, provide quality control inspections and ensure timely and effective resolution of issues. You will work closely with our customers’ installers, HVAC equipment sales and engineering teams to provide field support for VRF installations, identify opportunities for system improvements and upgrades, provide quality control on installations and provide feedback to ensure the continuous improvement of our products and services.
Responsibilities
- Providing onsite inspections of customers’ installations of VRF systems including equipment locations, refrigerant piping, and control wiring.
- Assisting customers to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with systems and equipment and provide effective solutions.
- Coordinating piping route changes from the field back to the office where VRF software will determine if the changes are acceptable to the system parameters.
- Perform repairs and replacements of defective equipment, components, or wiring.
- Commission new systems and equipment and ensure their proper operation.
- Communicate with customers to understand their needs and provide them with excellent customer service.
- Provide technical support and assistance to customers as needed.
- Keep accurate records of service calls, work performed, and materials used.
- Stay up to date with new technology, equipment, and tools related to building automation systems.
Requirements
- High school diploma or equivalent
- 2+ years of experience in HVAC field service or related field
- Understanding of HVAC equipment, controls, and electrical wiring
- Preferred Experience: variable refrigerant systems with an emphasis on installation
- Familiarity with programming and commissioning of variable refrigerant systems
- Experience with hard and soft copper refrigerant pipe installation
- Ability to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with systems and HVAC equipment.
- Excellent communication and customer service skills
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
- Travel required.
- Ability to work independently.
- Valid driver's license
ALBIREO ENERGY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 
Benefits
Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Basic Life Insurance
Voluntary Life Insurance
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Paid Vacation
Paid Sick Time
Paid Holidays
401K with Company match

title: Logistics Specialist
description:
Description:
Who we are:
The EDAG Group is a globally leading, independent engineering services provider that combines excellent engineering with the latest technology trends.
With a global network of some 60 branches, the EDAG Group realizes projects in the Vehicle Engineering, Electrics/Electronics and Production Solutions segments. Drawing on more than 50 years of engineering experience, EDAG's proprietary 360-degree development approach has become a hallmark of quality in the holistic development of vehicles and smart factories. The company's interdisciplinary expertise in the areas of software and digitization provides it with crucial skills to actively shape dynamic transformation processes as an innovative partner.
With an interdisciplinary team of around 8,600 experts, the EDAG Group develops unique mobility and industrial solutions for customers that include the world's leading automotive and non-automotive companies. The company is listed on the stock exchange since 2015 and generated revenues of € 796 million in 2022.
This is how you will grow:
- Resolve daily exceptions and escalate when needed 
- Align escalations with Network team and ensure execution of aligned countermeasures.
- Document issue and feedback
- Follow up on corrective actions and clean point. 
- Find and implement process improvements. 
- Charge back issues to causers. 
- Conduct regular meetings to track open topics. 
- Supports business needs for Inbound, Material Handling & Warehousing, and Outbound Sequencing. 
- Understands the interfaces for desired systematic communication.
- Create reports on process quality and system performance as required.
- Initiate and lead problem solving where needed to maintain process integrity. 
- Shop floor support for handling exceptions 
- Perform safe work practices and participate in trainings and safety programs in a positive and proactive way by following safety rules, procedures, regulations, standards and laws. 
- Report all unsafe acts, unsafe conditions, and injuries to supervisor or Human Resources.
- Work safely 100% of the time.
- Perform other duties as required.
Requirements:
This is how you will take us forward:
- Bachelors Degree in Supply Chain/Operations Management or Business Administration
- Related area or equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered
- Co-Op/ internship and/ or up to 2 years' professional experience in Material Handling experience with background in Logistics
- Knowledge in Warehousing, Outbound Shipment and Transportation 
- Ability to work different shifts and/or weekends if needed
- SAP know-how
- Ability to approach problems in a methodical and logical manner
- Technical competence with SAP and various software programs
- Knowledge of Logistics processes and systems
- SAP experience
- Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
- EDI system knowledge

description:
Description:

The EDAG Group is a globally leading, independent engineering services provider that combines excellent engineering with the latest technology trends.
With a global network of some 60 branches, the EDAG Group realizes projects in the Vehicle Engineering, Electrics/Electronics and Production Solutions segments. With an interdisciplinary team of around 8,600 experts, the EDAG Group develops unique mobility and industrial solutions for customers that include the world's leading automotive and non-automotive companies. The company is listed on the stock exchange since 2015 and generated revenues of € 796 million in 2022.
This is how you will grow:
The Plant IT Specialist is responsible for installing and supporting the IT hardware, software, and network infrastructure within the manufacturing facility.
-  Triage all IT hardware, software, and network issues in an office and on the manufacturing plant floor 
- Configure and deploy IT hardware equipment, such as printers, conference phones, conferencing systems, and mobile phones, while following hardware and software standards 
- Provide general application support 
- Maintain security, appearance, and organization of the server room 
- Partner across local departments—Engineering, HR, Maintenance, etc 
- Participate in special projects as needed
Requirements:
This is how you will take us forward:
- Bachelor’s Degree preferred, plus at least 1 year of professional IT Technical support experience
- Other desirable certifications include Network , Security , MCSE, CCNA, A 
- Solid understanding of PCs including software installation
- Experience configuring / troubleshooting issues / and deploying IT hardware, such as various printers, PCs, thin clients, scan guns, and/or radio frequency (RF) devices required 
- Understanding of networks and administration 
- Experience with inventory, asset management is a plus 
- Solid analytical and critical thinking skills with strong written and verbal communications skills 
- Demonstrated track record of strong initiative and producing results 
- Experience working in a manufacturing plant setting strongly preferred

title: ROI Specialist
description:
Description:
Description:
 The Release of Information (ROI) Specialist I within the VitalChart department of VRC Companies, LLC (“VRC”) is responsible for processing all assigned requests for medical records in a timely, efficient manner while ensuring accuracy and the highest quality service to healthcare clients. This position must, always, safeguard and protect the patient’s right to privacy by ensuring that only authorized individuals have access to the patient’s medical information and that all Release of Information requests follow the request authorization, VRC, and healthcare facility policies as well as federal/state statutes, such as HIPAA. Additionally, this position is required to continually perform at a high quality and productivity level. This position interacts with the ROI Area Manager and/or ROI Team Leader regularly and will keep them informed of any concerns or issues regarding quality, connectivity, client concerns, and requestor issues that may impact VRC performance or service expectations. This position must conduct interpersonal relationships in a manner designed to project a positive image of VRC.
Key Responsibilities / Essential Functions
- Assigned Release of Information request types will primarily be Continuing Care and Disability Determination Services, with cross-training on other request types as supervisor deems appropriate based on experience and performance
- Accesses Release of Information requests and medical records for healthcare client(s) according to the specific procedure and security protocol for each client
- Completes Release of Information requests daily, prioritizing requests as needed based on turnaround timeframes and procedures of VRC and the service agreement between the healthcare facility and VRC
- validates requests and signed patient authorizations for compliance with HIPAA, other applicable federal and state statutes, and established procedure
- classifies request type correctly
- logs request into ROI software
- retrieves and uploads requested portions of the patient’s medical chart (from electronic or physical repository)
- performs Quality Control checks to ensure accuracy of the release and to avoid breaches of Protected Health Information (PHI)
- checks for accurate invoicing and adjusts invoice as needed
- releases request to the valid requesting entity
- Rejects requests for records that are not HIPAA-compliant or otherwise valid
- For records pulled from a physical repository, returns records to proper location per VRC and healthcare client procedure
- Documents in ROI software all exceptions, communications, and other relevant information related to a request
- Alerts supervisor to any questionable or unusual requests or communications
- Alerts supervisor to any discovered or suspected breaches immediately
- Alerts supervisor to any issues that will delay the timely release of records
- Answers requestor inquiries about a request in an informative, respectful, efficient manner
- Stores all records and files properly and securely before leaving work area.
- Ensures adequate office supplies available to carry out tasks as soon as they arise
- Is available and knowledgeable to take on additional healthcare facilities or request types to assist during backlogs
- Understands that healthcare facility assignments (on-site and/or remote) are subject to change
- Carries out responsibilities in accordance with VRC and healthcare facility policies and procedures as well as HIPAA, state/federal regulations, and labor regulations
- Maintains confidentiality, security, and standards of ethics with all information
- Works with privileged information in a conscientious manner while releasing medical records in an efficient, effective, and accurate manner
- Alerts supervisor to any connectivity problems, malfunctions of software or computer/office equipment, or security risks in work environment
- Must adhere to all VRC policies and procedures.
- Completes required training within the allotted timeframe
- Creating invoices and billing materials to send to our clients
- Ensuing that client information details are kept up to date 
- All other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Minimum Knowledge, Skills, Experience Required
- High School Diploma (GED) required; degree preferred
- Prior experience with ROI fulfillment preferred
- Demonstrated attention to detail
- Demonstrated ability to prioritize, organize, and meet deadlines
- Demonstrated documentation and communication skills
- Demonstrated ability to maintain productivity and quality performance
- Basic knowledge of medical records and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) preferred
- Prior experience with EHR/EMR platforms preferred
- Prior experience with Windows environment and Microsoft Office products
- Displays strong interpersonal skills with team members, clients, and requestors
- Must have strong computer skills and Microsoft Office skills
- Prior experience with operations of equipment such as printers, computers, fax machines, scanners, and microfilm reader/printers, etc. preferred
- Must be detailed oriented, self-motivated and can stay focused on tasks for extended periods of time.
- Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend English. Bilingual skills are desirable.
Working Conditions
- Requires ability to work 8 hours quietly at a computer screen and keyboard/mouse.
- Requires ability to withstand pressures of constant deadlines, training demands, and changing healthcare environment.
- Job involves standing, walking, sitting, stooping, pushing, pulling, and crouching.
- Manual dexterity and strength sufficient to enter information via computer keyboard for long periods of time, to write a notes and information needed, and to pick up and hold paperwork, supplies, and other items.
- Eyesight sufficient to effectively read documents and to accurately view information on a computer monitor
- Speaking and hearing ability sufficient to communicate effectively
- Eye/hand coordination, hearing, and visual acuity necessary for day-to-day tasks
- The ability to lift 20 pounds occasionally and 10 pounds frequently.
- Should be able to reach and extend arms in any direction.
- Must be able to respond in a professional manner to angry customers and requestors, both internally and externally, and refer to supervisor as direct and/or as good judgment dictates.
- Must be open to change (positive or negative) and to consider variety in the workplace.
- Must have the ability to accept criticism and deal calmly and effectively with high stress situations.
- Physical presence on-site is essential unless assignment is 100% remote.
- Hearing and vision must be normal or corrected to within normal range.
- Able to perform the duties with or without reasonable accommodation.
- Display a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges.
- May require travel to healthcare facilities if assigned to on-site ROI role.
A thorough understanding of this role and tasks and how they impact the organization and its strategic and financial goals and how they affect the integrity of the organization’s data and information.
A commitment to discuss questions and recommendations about processes and any observed variations in performing tasks to ensure a standardized approach to work and services provided.
Participation in education as required for corporate compliance and role-specific functions and tasks.

title: TPL Engineer - Mechanical Planning Specialist -
description:
PURPOSE: 
Under general supervision, this role is responsible for coordinating and overseeing the planning and execution of the mechanical systems within an automotive manufacturing process/environment. 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
- Body in white manufacturing equipment planning
- Check, 3D component data, joining technology and fixture clamping sequence
- Research optimize and evaluate the scheme of body in white production line planning
- Make flow chart, line drawings, assembly line data table and safety drawings, etc
- Make inquiry information, product information and presentations
- Planning scheme demonstration and to discuss details with design supplier and customers
- Track all changes arising from the project (such as changes of parts, plan, detailed description, ECR, engineering change request)
- Participate in FMEA analysis (that is, the failure modes and effects analysis), MTM analysis (i.e., time measurement analysis), data analysis, etc. FMEA
- Take over part of the project tasks
- According to the requirement of project , coordinate and calibration with designer and simulation engineer
- Make claims for technical purchase parts, and follow up the orders and shipments until the arrival at OEM or onsite.
- Technical interface to customer, supplier and onsite team during the whole project phase (basically the right hand for technical questions for the project manager)
- Foundation plan and buy-off document
- Project specification and data prepare
- Project report and status tracking
- Trouble shooting for engineering phase and onsite phase
- Responsible for implementing technical solutions in terms of time, cost and quality
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
- This position requires an Bachelors Degree in major in mechanical or automotive related or mechanical graduated from the vocational technical college and career in related training.
REQUIRED SKILLS:
- Work experience in automotive industry
- Knowledge of CAD software, such as CATIA V5, Micro Station CAD CATIA V5, Micro Station
- Knowledge of programming software ,ie eM-Planner, Delmia
- Knowledge of MS Office ,especially MS Excel
- Has the team consciousness and organization talent, systematic, analytical and structured way of working
- Candidate must be familiar with the company’s quality procedures, strictly follow the company’s quality system of ISO 9001:2015
 
PREFERRED SKILLS: 
- Ability to clearly communicate technical information, both verbally and in writing. 
- Work experience with equipment and tooling related issues 
-  Experience in project management and in leading problem solving groups 
- Knowledge in system applications such as SAP, CAD 
- Drafting skills 
-  German Language proficiency 
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
- 
- Work is normally performed in an office, laboratory, manufacturing floor, or machine shop setting where physical work includes, but is not limited to, sitting, standing, reaching, kneeling, bending, and lifting up to 25 lbs.
- Must be able to understand and comply with all relevant safety practices.
FLSA STATUS/WORKING SCHEDULE
:
- 
- Location: Vance, AL 
- Schedule: Day Shift 
- Weekly Overtime: As needed 
- Weekend Work: As needed
- Assignment Start: ASAP
- Assignment End: 1 Year Contract
DISCLAIMER:
This job description is a high-level overview of general expectations of this position. It is not intended to list every responsibility of the position, nor does it represent an employment contract of any

title: Quality EHS Manager (12-Month Contract)
description:
Company Overview
 
BLG LOGISTICS is a seaport and logistics service provider with an international network. For more than 145 years, our hallmark has been logistics driven by both passion and pragmatism. We create logistics for our customers in retail and industry by applying our expertise to develop and implement innovative, highly sophisticated, and future-oriented solutions. Today, the BLG Group is represented with almost 100 locations and branches in Europe, America, Africa, and Asia. Our AUTOMOBILE and CONTAINER divisions are market leaders in Europe. Our CONTRACT division is among Germany's leading providers.
BLG LOGISTICS aims to be climate-neutral by 2030. In fact, we are the first German logistics service provider with a scientifically recognized climate protection goal. As an employer, we foster a personal touch, value our employees' contribution, and keep our sights firmly on the future. Including all associated companies, BLG LOGISTICS currently provides some 20,000 jobs worldwide.
This role is a 12-Month Contract.
This role requires 50% of travel to all 5 of our locations. 
- Northport, AL
- Vance, AL
- Greenville, SC
- Spartanburg, SC
- Ladson, SC
Benefits
- Medical
- Dental 
- Vision
- Company Paid Benefits:
- Short Term Disability
- Long Term Disability
- Life Insurance
- Accidental Death and Dismemberment
- Paid Time Off/Vacation Time
- 12 Paid Holidays
- Safe Harbor & ROTH 401K Retirement plan with Company Match. 
- Supplemental Insurance 
- Fraud Remediation Plan 
- Summary:
 
Manages the overall QM and QA needs for the Company, including but not limited to: ISO Certification, Internal Audits, External Audits, Customer Audits, Operational and Administrative Quality support, Environmental Health and Safety, standards and implementations, and point of contact for all Quality related questions.
 
- Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
- Understands the quality requirements for the processes he/she works with.
- Inspects the operations to ensure that the correct processes, and quality standards are being followed.
- Develops and manages the system audit within the product line and areas by establishing requirements and measurement.
- Develop a quality plan with clear definition of objectives and actions with timelines.
- Complete process audits for conformance to instructions and customer requirements.
- Develop plans to be able to meet ISO system requirements.
- Leads efforts in achieving BLG Quality Management System Requirements.
- Compiles and writes training materials and conducts training sessions on quality topics.
- Direct activities of Quality department associates.
- Assists operations in achieving total customer satisfaction in Quality, Delivery, and Cost.
- Takes a leadership partnership role with continuous improvement.
- Review claims and quality Issues with Operations, support countermeasures identification and audit implementation. Is expected to be able to communicate key issues and actions.
- Develops and maintains the system to ensure Inspection Instructions are up to date, if applicable.
- BIC Maintenance
- Update the organizational matrix of records
- Performs other related duties as assigned by management.
- Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position have supervisor responsibilities over the Quality Engineers & Quality Specialist position.
- Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
- Education and/or Experience:
- College Degree or equivalent with at least 2 years of education beyond or at least 10+ years of experience working in a quality environment.
- Experience in conducting internal audits and quality control.
- Significant work with ISO and other certifications.
- Knowledge and expertise with Environmental Health and Safety regulations.
- Experience in creating standards and implementation. 
- Skills and Knowledge:
- Advanced analytical skills including investigation.
- Ability to focus on detail and understanding the focus of the organization.
- Strong communication skills with teams and customers.
- Computer literate within the PC environment. Basic computer skills.
- Percentage of time performing the job will include: 10% standing, 10% walking, 10% writing, 40% checking, 20% observing, 5% speaking and 5% listening.
- Reasoning Ability:
Ability to interpret data and recognize and document trends. Ability to utilize analytical tools and common sense understanding to implement problem solving and improvement measures.
- Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
Certification relating to logistics and quality management are advantageous but not required. (e.g. CSCMP, Six-Sigma, etc.) Valid Driver’s License is required.
 
- Other Skills and Abilities:
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database software; Project Management software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. Ability to speak, write and understand German and Spanish; preferred but not required.
- Other Qualifications:
May be required to support the ramp-up of facilities and projects outside of the Southeastern United States. The ability and willingness to travel, including for extended periods, is a necessity of the job. 
- Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.
- Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job is usually performed in an office environment, but may necessitate activities in a production or other environment of a client. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

description:

:
The EDAG Group is a globally leading, independent engineering services provider that combines excellent engineering with the latest technology trends.

- Core Working Hours:7am 4pm, Monday Friday 
- Weekly Overtime:2 hours per day as needed 
- Weekend Work: Only as needed
- Travel: 50% in the U.S. only, etc.
- Cell Phone Required: Yes
- Special PPE Required: Standard Assembly shop PPE
- Assignment Start: January 2, 2024
- Assignment End:December 21, 2024 with potential for an extension of contract
Relocation expenses may be offered for highly qualified candidates, but that rate must be referenced in the attached bid form.Preference will be given to local candidates
Please reply with an updated resume in Microsoft Word format
JOB DESCRIPTION
Under general supervision, this position is responsible for the color harmony audit process and support of Manufaktur launch. Performs the checks, analyze results, and document the results in computer systems. Advanced planning of the process and initiates problem solving when a discrepancy is identified and tracks until a resolution is implemented. Ability to perform processes and maintain these systems throughout the life cycle of the given product. Supports Central Q in the analysis, prioritization, investigation, and ultimate resolution of product concerns throughout the product life.
Duties and responsibilities
- Assure customer satisfaction for both our internal and external customers by maintaining and performing the color harmony audit process and ensure that company complies with all relevant company standards.
- Perform and train on the use of inspection and test plans, standards and acceptance criteria and procedures/work instructions, according to company standards (MBN/VAs).
- Adapt Color Harmony Audit process for new models, new colors, and running changes.
- Develop reports in order to provide the results to the organization.
- Coordinate with internal/external partners in regular meetings.Lead Role for Interior Color / Support Role for Exterior Color.
- Investigate and eliminate any non conformities in the color harmony audit process and follow up on corrective actions, including but not limited to conducting line trial and special evaluations.
- Implement and maintain reporting database and supporting software within the Color Harmony Audit Process.
- Implement and maintain inspection tools and equipment within the Color Harmony Audit
- Perform safe work practices and participate in trainings and safety programs in a positive and proactive way by following safety rules, procedures, regulations, standards and laws.Report all unsafe acts, unsafe conditions, and injuries to supervisor or Human Resources.
- Support of MANUFAKTUR launch.
- Work safely 100% of the time.
- Perform other duties as required.
Professional Experience
Co-Op/ internship and/ or up to 2 years' professional experience in the following area:
- Quality function in an automotive manufacturing environment.
Required Skills 
(These skills are essential to perform the job)
- Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
- Working knowledge of MS Office applications.
- Proven capability to audit vehicles parts.
- Strong written and verbal communication skills.
- Ability to pass Ishara Color Blindness and FM 100 Hue tests.
Preferred skills 
(These skills are not essential but useful)
- Working knowledge of ISO 14000, ISO/TS 16949 Management systems.
- Working experience in QDA, SmartChart, PLUS, MRS, ZEUS, and CAT systems.
- Experience in assessing cost of quality.
- German language skills.
Minimum Level of Education 
(Note: Engineering and/or IT MUST require technical degrees)
This position requires a bachelors degree in:
- Mechanical Engineering
- Industrial Engineering
- Computer Engineering/Computer Science
- Chemical Engineering
- Or related area or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
Company Description
Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is one of the leading automotive service providers in the nation with over 300 locations across 21 states. We employ experienced, certified technicians trained to provide premium total-car care, and we use state-of-the-art equipment and premium parts to ensure the quality of our work. In addition to the oil change, our teams are capable of providing specialty services, tire services, as well as a variety of mechanical services, while continuing to place an emphasis on customer experience and being your one-stop automotive service provider. Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers continues to grow while maintaining our vision to continuously be the preeminent automotive maintenance provider, leading our industry through excellence, innovation, and growth.
Job Description
The Accounts Receivable Specialist will assist the Accounts Receivable department in the daily functions of the Express Oil Change & Tire Engineer’s chain-wide Fleet Billing Platform (currently encompasses billing and credit management for more than 25 companies, more than 200 stores and approximately 2,000 plus statements per month) to insure successful operations. The Accounts Receivable Specialist's primary function and focus will be on collections and Accounts Payable, but they will also assist in posting cash receipts.
Primary Responsibilities
 
include (but are not limited to):
- Perform collections activities including phone calls and emails 
- Utilize Lockstep Collect software to document contacts and maintain daily record of customer interactions
- Assist with cash receipt posting: ACH and check payments
- Assist with all customer inquiries related to copies of invoices, if necessary 
- Assist with mailing and emailing of statements to customers
- Assist store managers and Franchise owners with fleet billing inquiries 
- Ad hoc duties as assigned
Qualifications
We are looking for:
- Minimum of 5 years of Accounting/Collections experience
- Proficiency in Lockstep Collect Software preferred
- Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 a plus
- Experience with Sage 100 preferred
- Strong knowledge of Microsoft products (including Word, Excel) preferred
- Proficiency with Adobe Acrobat Pro required
- Must be willing to call customers daily to follow up on past due accounts
- Must have excellent communications skills, both oral and written
Additional Information
All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Work Opportunity Tax Credits – Express Oil
Express Oil participates in the Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) program, which ADP administers on behalf of the company. Please follow the steps listed below to screen for the WOTC program. We appreciate your cooperation.
 Applicant Instructions
- Open https://tcs.adp.com/mavistac 
- Please answer each question to complete the voluntary screening
- Eligible applicants will be asked to Electronically Sign and click Submit to complete the screening
- Ineligible applicants will be asked to click Submit to finish the screening; You will not be asked to electronically sign

title: Precision Measurement Service Technician I
description:
Job Summary: 
Responsible for performing quality calibrations adhering to corporate quality standards and procedures.
Essential Functions:
- 
Calibration encompassing the following core disciplines: Temperature, Pressure, Flow, Vibration, Mass, Electrical, Electronics, Time, Frequency, Radio Frequency, Torque, Force and Dimension. Additional training will be provided post-hire as needed.
- 
Prepare for all on-sites as assigned by Lead Tech or Service Manager; this includes reviewing equipment lists, procedures, specifications, and ensuring proper standards are selected for work assigned.
- 
Person must ensure he/she has calibration stickers, PMD work orders, worksheets, tags, cleaning supplies, directions, customer contact information and survey cards; downloading customer information to an on-site laptop may be required.
- 
Person must ensure all company issued tools and property are in proper working order and in calibration.
- 
Perform clerical work associated with calibration activities including certificates of calibration. Must provide the original data worksheet for final inspection by Quality.
- 
Perform quality inspection of calibrated equipment as approved by the Quality Manager.
- 
All certificates for equipment calibrated on-site and in house shall be completed in a timely manner (within 48 hours of job completion.)
- 
Keep in good order all tools and equipment, practice good housekeeping
- 
Maintain a safety and customer service mindset at all times
- 
Consistently maintain good work attendance and productive work ethic.
- 
Will perform other duties as assigned by the Service Manager
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
- 
A strong understanding of a wide variety of precision measurement equipment, to include the care and use of Instrumentation, Gages, and Precision Measurement Equipment; calibration program management, and Measurement Principles.
- 
Be proficient in gage management software
- 
Be computer proficient in all Microsoft Office applications
- 
Have a strong understanding of computer system peripherals and communication configurations
- 
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
- 
Have excellent written and oral communication skills, both internally and externally
- 
Demonstrate self motivation, initiative, honesty, integrity, and attention to detail
- 
Have a valid driver’s license and clean driving record
- 
Associates Degree in a technical discipline preferred; Instrumentation, Industrial, Mechanical, or Electronics Engineering, for example. Navy or Marine Corp GCAMS / ACTS , AF PMEL, or Army MOS – 94H Test Measurement & Diagnostic Equipment Support Specialist
Core Competencies
- 
Commitment to Excellence - Check your work
- 
Customer Relationship Management - communicate with customers to deliver better service
- 
Methodical Approach - troubleshooting
- 
Team Building
Physical Demands:
Stands greater than four hours at a time
May require walking 2 – 4 miles during an 8 hour period
Stoops and bends below knee level 2 – 4 times an hour
Lifts and carries less than 50 pounds but greater than 25 pounds repetitively
Climbs stairs more than four times in an eight hour shift
Pushes / pulls objects greater than 25 pounds
Reaches out
Reaches overhead
Repetitively uses feet
Repetitively uses hands (computer keyboard)
Grips with hands
